effects: [["Causes Isaac's [[familiar]]s to stay closer to Isaac."]]

notes: [['Cannot appear in [[Greed Mode]].'], ['If Rib of Greed is picked up after a Greed fight in a {{R|Shop}} or a {{R|Secret Room}}, reentering the room will turn the room into a regular shop with items for sale or a secret room respectively (while keeping the previously dropped items on the floor).']]

name: Store Key
description: {{r|Shop}}s can be opened without using {{E|Key}}s.

notes: [['Cannot appear in [[Greed Mode]].'], ['{{c|Keeper}} starts with this trinket after he defeats {{E|Satan}}.'], ['{{dlc|r}} This trinket is useless for {{c|Tainted Keeper}}, as all shops are always open for him.']]

effects: [['Donating to a {{M|Donation Machine}} has a chance to do one of the following:', ['Heal Isaac for a full {{E|red heart}}', 'Spawn a {{M|Beggar}}', "Get a {{E|penny}} back, directly added to Isaac's total"]], ["Increases the chance that donating to a Donation Machine will increase Isaac's [[luck]]."]]

name: Silver Dollar
description: {{R|Shop}}s appear in [[Chapters|Chapter 4]].
effects: [['{{R|Shop}}s appear in the {{s|Womb}}, {{s|Utero}}, and {{s|Scarred Womb}}.', ['{{dlc|r}} Also spawns {{R|Shop}}s in the {{s|Corpse}}.']]]
notes: [['Cannot appear in [[Greed Mode]].'], ['This trinket must already be held upon starting the Womb/Utero/Scarred Womb/Corpse floor for the effect to take place, i.e. the trinket needs to be carried over from the previous floor.'], ["Silver Dollar only needs to be held when entering the floor. The Shop will remain after dropping the trinket, even if it hasn't been explored yet."]]

name: Bloody Crown
description: {{R|Treasure Room}}s appear in [[chapter 4]].
effects: [['{{R|Treasure Room}}s appear in the {{s|Womb}}, {{s|Utero}}, and {{s|Scarred Womb}}.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Treasure Rooms also appear in the {{s|Corpse}}.']]
notes: [['Cannot appear in [[Greed Mode]].'], ['This trinket must already be held upon starting the Womb/Utero/Scarred Womb floor for the effect to take place, i.e., the trinket needs to be carried over from the previous floor.'], ["Bloody Crown only needs to be held when entering the floor. The Treasure Room will remain after dropping the trinket, even if it hasn't been explored yet."], ['{{Curse|xl}} floors will have 2 treasure rooms, like any other XL floor.'], ['{{Dlc|r}}The Treasure Rooms that appear in Corpse will have 2 items, one behind a {{curse|blind}} like the other Alt Path floors.'], ['This trinket does not work if held during a challenge run that impedes {{R|Treasure Room}}s from spawning.']]

name: Tonsil
description: When hit, there is a small chance a removed tonsil [[familiar]] starts following Isaac, blocking enemy shots.

This allows Isaac to drop the trinket while keeping the familiar.', ['{{dlc|nr}} The passive Tonsil item does not exist in any item pool; thus, this is the only way to find it and make it appear in the [[Collection Page (Afterbirth †)#Page 4|Collection Page]] aside from starting with it as {{C|Eden}}.']], ['{{dlc|nr}} If Eden starts with the passive tonsil item and picks up the trinket, the trinket will spawn only one familiar before being consumed.'], ['Sources of self-inflicted damage, like {{I|IV Bag}} or {{M|Blood Donation Machine}}s, can spawn a familiar.'], ['Damage that is blocked by {{I|Holy Mantle}} or the {{p|Holy Card}} does not count to the number of hits that are needed for the tonsil familiar to spawn.']]

effects: [['Adds a chance to fire a black tooth that [[poison]]s enemies.', ["Black teeth deal double Isaac's normal [[Damage|tear damage]].", 'The chance scales with [[luck]] very slowly, with barely noticeable increase until close to 30 luck, and at 32 luck every tear is a tooth.']]]

effects: [['After Isaac is hit by 1-9 explosions, the Walnut will be destroyed and spawns a {{E|Penny|display=Coin}}, a {{E|Red Heart|display=Heart}}, a {{E|key}} and another [[trinket]]. The pickups may be of any normal variety.']]
notes: [['Taking damage from the explosion is not required to trigger the effect.']]

notes: [['Flies may spawn on top of each other, appearing as a single fly initially.']]

effects: [['Makes two {{r|Secret Room}}s spawn upon entering a new floor with this trinket.']]

description: {{E|Black Poop}}s can drop {{E|Black Heart|display=Black Hearts}} when destroyed. {{E|Poop}} has a chance to turn into {{E|Black Poop|force=n}}.

notes: [['Not affected by [[Luck]].']]

name: Cracked Crown
description:
{{dlc|nr}} Decreases Isaac's [[tear delay]] by 20%, and improves the effectiveness of his other [[Attributes|stat]] upgrades by 33%.
{{dlc|r}} Improves the effectiveness of stat upgrades by 20%.
effects: [['{{dlc|nr}} -20% [[tear delay]] (increased rate of fire)', ["{{dlc|nr}} Since this directly affects tear delay instead of changing the tears stat, it allows Isaac's rate of fire to go over the normal maximum rate.", '{{dlc|nr}} Tear delay decreases are more noticeable and are a greater increase to DPS when the tears stat is high.']], ['Boosts [[speed]], [[range]], [[shot speed]], [[damage]], and {{dlc|r}} [[tears]] if they are above their base values.', ['Affects stat bonuses from passive items, trinkets that are absorbed or in a second trinket slot, and permanent bonuses given by items such as {{i|Void}}.', "{{dlc|nr}} The extra stat upgrades are 33% of any final stat calculations over its base value (which is equivalent to {{c|Isaac}}'s base stats), for example with 4.5 damage, it is 1 damage over the base 3.5, and the 1 damage gets buffed to 1.33, ending up with a total of 4.83 damage.", "{{dlc|r}} The extra stat upgrades are 20% of any final stat calculations over its base value (which is equivalent to {{c|Isaac}}'s base stats), for example with 4.5 damage, it is 1 damage over the base 3.5, and the 1 damage gets buffed to 1.2, ending up with a total of 4.7 damage.", ['Fire rate multipliers change what is considered to be the base value, so with {{i|Soy Milk}}, only tears ups above 15.00 will gain a bonus.', ["The only exception is {{i|Eye Drops}}, which gains a bonus to its 1.2x fire rate multiplier if it's above base."], "Direct fire rate modifiers like {{i|Mom's Perfume}} do not get a bonus."]]]]
notes: [["The trinket does nothing for the listed boostable stats if they are at or below the base value; the boost is calculated on the ''total'' bonus, not per item."], ['[[Luck]] is not affected by Cracked Crown.'], ['[[Speed]] will not exceed over 2.0.']]

name: Used Diaper
description: Grants the {{i|Skatole}} effect in some rooms.

This chance is seeded into each room and isn't affected by [[Luck]].", ['For a list of what flies are affected and how, see the {{I|Skatole}} page.']], ['Dropping the trinket will not revert {{E|Fly|display=Flies}}, but will undo the other benefits.']]

description: Tears travel in a large spiral pattern and gain [[spectral]], with a small chance to gain [[homing]]. {{dlc|r}} Also adds +0.4 [[Tears]].
effects: [['Tears travel in a large spiral pattern.'], ['Grants [[Tear Effects#Spectral|spectral tears]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +4.0 [[range]].', ['{{dlc|r}} +1.5 [[range]], +0.4 [[tears]].']], ['{{dlc|nr}} +2.0 [[tear falling speed]].'], ['A [[luck]]-based chance for a [[Tear Effects#Homing|homing]] shot, reaching 100% at 9 luck.', ['The homing shots are not different in appearance.', 'The homing does not override the spiral pattern, making them still unreliable.']]]

description: Makes tears have a chance to bounce off enemies and obstacles.

notes: [['Tears will bounce off of walls while fighting {{E|The Beast}}, despite the lack of visible walls.']]

name: Vibrant Bulb
description: Provides a boost to all [[Attributes|stats]] when Isaac's active item is fully charged.
effects: [["Increases all [[Attributes|stats]] while Isaac's active item is fully charged:", ['+0.25 [[speed]].', '+0.75 [[range]].', '{{dlc|nr}} +0.50 [[tear falling speed]].', '+0.20 [[tears]].', '+0.10 [[shot speed]].', '+0.50 [[damage]].', '+1 [[luck]].']]]
notes: [['The trinket creates no effect if Isaac has no active item.'], ["{{dlc|nr}} Active items that are reusable indefinitely without a charge bar, such as {{i|How to Jump}}, will allow Vibrant Bulb's effects to be permanent (until the active item is swapped out)."], ['Vibrant Bulb is slightly less than half as powerful as {{t|Dim Bulb|n}}; however, its effects are active more often.'], ['{{i|Glowing Hour Glass|n}}, when used, will not make the Vibrant Bulb inactive and will still provide the bonus until it has one bar of charge.'], ["Having additional charge beyond full with {{i|The Battery}} does not provide an additional bonus. It does give an advantage however, since using the fully charged item once still provides Vibrant Bulb's effect."], ["If two active items are held ({{i|Schoolbag|n}}), the one currently active must be at full charge for the trinket to take effect (the other one doesn't need to be fully charged)."], ["{{dlc|r}} Vibrant Bulb produces no effect with active items in consumable slots, e.g. {{c|Tainted Apollyon}}'s {{i|Abyss|n}} or {{c|Tainted Bethany}}'s {{i|Lemegeton|n}}."], ['{{Dlc|r}} If {{c|Bethany}} or {{c|Tainted Bethany}} are holding enough soul/red hearts to charge her current active item, the Vibrant Bulb will be active, even if there are no regular charges.', ['If the active item is fully charged only with soul/blood charges and no regular charges, Vibrant Bulb and Dim Bulb can be both active at the same time if Isaac holds both of the trinkets.']]]

name: Dim Bulb
description: Provides a boost to all [[Attributes|stats]] when Isaac's active item is completely uncharged.
effects: [["Increases all [[Attributes|stats]] while Isaac's active item is completely uncharged:", ['+0.50 [[speed]].', '+1.50 [[range]].', '{{dlc|nr}} +1.00 [[tear falling speed]]', '{{dlc|nr}} +0.40 [[tears]].', '{{dlc|r}} +0.50 [[tears]].', '+0.30 [[shot speed]].', '+1.5 [[damage]].', '+2 [[luck]].']], ['Items that charge automatically will get only a tiny moment of benefit from the Dim Bulb before they gain more charge again.'], ["{{dlc|nr}} If Isaac's active item has no charge bar and can be used anytime, like {{i|How to Jump}}, Dim Bulb's effects will be permanent."]]
notes: [['Dim Bulb is more than twice as powerful as {{t|Vibrant Bulb}}; however, its effects are active less frequently.', ["However, 1 room charge items can be used at the start of each room to effectively get the Dim Bulb's effects constantly."]], ['Dim Bulb has no effect when no active item is held.'], ['If the player has 2 items (via {{i|Schoolbag}}), only 1 of them needs to be empty to receive the benefits.', ["This appears to have been patched out on PC. {{dlc|nr}} However, if one of your two active items has no charge bar (e.g. {{i|Remote Detonator}}), you can swap to it after using the charged item to preserve the Bulb's effect."]]]

name: Bag Lunch
description: Taking damage has a small chance to destroy the trinket and spawn {{i|Lunch}}.
effects: [['Taking damage has a 2% chance to destroy the trinket and spawn {{i|Lunch}}.']]

name: Lost Cork
description: Increases the radius of any [[creep]] produced by Isaac.
effects: [['Increases the radius of all [[creep]] produced by Isaac and his familiars.']]

name: Crow Heart
description: {{E|Red Heart}} damage will be taken before {{E|Soul Heart}}, {{E|Black Heart}}, and {{E|Rotten Heart}} damage.
effects: [['{{E|Red Heart}} damage will be taken before {{E|Soul Heart}}, {{E|Black Heart}}, and {{E|Rotten Heart}} damage.', ['With {{E|Bone Heart}}s, Red Hearts contained within the Bone Hearts will be taken before regular Red Heart damage, but the Bone Hearts will not be fully depleted.', 'If Isaac only has half a Red Heart left, Soul and Black Heart damage will be taken, and Bone Hearts can be destroyed.']]]
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} This is useful for getting into {{R|Boss Challenge Room}} when you want to maintain your Soul/Black Hearts but have more than one filled Red Heart container.', ['{{Dlc|r}}Does not work anymore since you need a health total of 1 Heart or less instead of a Red Heart total to enter Boss Challenge Rooms.']], ['Red Heart damage taken via the trinket does NOT affect your {{R|Devil Room}}/{{R|Angel Room}} chances normally.', ['{{Dlc|r}}Red heart damage taken via the trinket will now affect your {{R|Devil Room}}/{{R|Angel Room}} chances normally.']], ['This is useful when playing as {{C|The Forgotten}}, as it will preserve his Bone Hearts (and Devil/Angel Room chance) until all of his Bone Hearts are empty.', ['This trinket does nothing while controlling {{C|The Soul}}.']]]

effects: [['Stops orbital familiars from rotating around Isaac.'], ['Stops shooting familiars from moving.']]
notes: [['Familiars are stopped in the exact position they are when Duct Tape is picked up. Position of familiars can be changed by dropping Duct Tape and picking it up again.'], ['Blue Flies orbiting Isaac move less relative to Isaac.']]

name: Pay to Win
description: {{dlc+}}{{M|Shop Restock Machine}}s always spawn in Item Rooms.{{dlc-}}
effects: [['{{M|Shop Restock Machine}}s or "Restock Boxes" always spawn in {{R|Treasure Room}}s.']]
notes: [["The trinket's effect applies when the floor is generated, so it will only take effect if already held when entering a new floor. This means that finding it on a floor will not change the Treasure Room on that floor, nor will dropping it remove its effect on that floor's Treasure Room if Pay to Win was held when the floor was entered.", ['{{dlc|r}} This also means that the trinket will have no effect in the [[Ascent]], since it is based on previously generated floors.']], ['This trinket does not affect the two Treasure Rooms spawned in {{Stage|???}}.'], ['In [[Greed Mode]], this affects both normal and silver types of Treasure Rooms.'], ['{{dlc|r}} When brought to the alternate path floors, there seems to be a high chance of the treasure room having one extra item available to be picked up alongside the usual choice of two items.'], ["{{dlc|r}} Restock boxes will not appear in the [[Mirrored World|Mirrored World's]] Treasure Room."]]

name: Locust of War
description: Upon entering a room with enemies for the first time, spawns a [[Locust|Red Locust]] which detonates upon impact with enemies.
effects: [['Upon entering a room with enemies for the first time, spawns a [[Familiars#Locusts|Red Locust]] which detonates upon impact with enemies, dealing double tear damage for the impact of the Locust and 60 damage for the explosion.']]
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} This trinket can be dangerous to hold, as the locust will instantly target the nearest enemy as Isaac enters the room, which can be close enough to catch Isaac in its blast radius.', ['{{dlc|r}} The explosion from the locust is very small, on scale of a single tile, but can still hurt Isaac.']], ['The Locust will also spawn each time a wave starts in {{R|Boss Rush}}.'], ['The explosion takes most bomb effects from items that Isaac has, with some exceptions.']]

description: Upon entering a room with enemies, spawns a [[Locust|Green Locust]] which damages and poisons enemies.
effects: [["Upon entering a room with enemies, spawns a [[Familiars#Locusts|Green Locust]] that deals double Isaac's damage and poisons enemies, which deals double Isaac's damage over time."]]
notes: [['The Locust will also spawn each time a wave starts in {{R|Boss Rush}}.'], ['During [[Greed Mode]], locusts will not spawn when waves start.']]

notes: [['The Locust will also spawn each time a wave starts in {{r|Boss Rush}}.'], ['During [[Greed Mode]], locusts will not spawn when waves start.']]

name: Locust of Death
description: Upon entering a room with enemies, spawns a [[Locust|Black Locust]] that does a very high amount of damage.
effects: [["Upon entering a room with enemies, spawns a [[Familiars#Locusts|Black Locust]] that deals quadruple Isaac's damage, applied as two hits of double damage."]]
notes: [['The Locust will also spawn each time a wave starts in {{R|Boss Rush}}.'], ['The Locust will not spawn each time a wave in [[Greed Mode]] starts.'], ['If the player has exited the game, the Locust will spawn upon continuing from the main menu, allowing multiple locusts to spawn for the same room by repeatedly exiting.']]

description: Upon entering a room with enemies, spawns 2-5 [[Locust|White Locusts]] which damage enemies.
effects: [["Upon entering a room with enemies, spawns 1-4 [[Familiars#Locusts|White Locusts]] that deal double Isaac's damage."]]
notes: [['The Locusts will also spawn each time a wave starts in {{R|Boss Rush}}.'], ['The Locusts will not spawn each time a wave in [[Greed Mode]] starts.']]

name: Bat Wing
description: Upon killing an enemy, has a chance to grant [[flight]] for the rest of the room.
effects: [['Upon killing an enemy, has a chance to grant [[flight]] for the rest of the room.']]
notes: [['Destroying a {{E|Shopkeeper}} counts as a kill.']]

description:
{{Dlc|nr}} Heals Isaac for a {{E|Half Red Heart}} upon traveling to the next floor.

effects: [['{{dlc|nr}} Heals for a {{E|Half Red Heart}} upon traveling to the next floor.'], ["{{dlc|r}} Heals 50% of Isaac's empty {{E|Red Heart}}s and {{E|Bone Heart|n}}s (rounded down), but at minimum a half heart, upon traveling to the next floor."]]

description: Fully recharges Isaac's active item upon entering a boss fight.

notes: [["The trinket's effect will trigger once for each and every Boss Room. Even if there are multiple Boss rooms on the same floor for whatever reason ({{cu|xl}}, {{s|The Void}})"], ['In [[Greed Mode]], grants a full charge only for the two boss fights on the final level.'], ["The effect is identical to picking up a {{E|lil' battery}}, with caveats listed in interactions."], ['{{dlc|r}} Recharges twice on {{s|Corpse}} II: 1st time happens when entering the boss room, 2nd time happens when entering the {{e|Mother|n}} fight.'], ['{{dlc+|r}} Does not fully recharge between {{e|Dogma}} and {{e|The Beast}}.{{dlc-}}']]

notes: [['The shield granted by Wooden Cross stacks with {{i|Holy Mantle}}, {{i|Blanket}}, and {{i|Dogma}}.', ['It does not, however, stack with the {{p|Holy Card}}; both are treated as the same shield.']], ['The shield of Wooden Cross has a higher priority than Holy Mantle or Blanket and will be lost first when hit.']]

name: Butter!
description: Using an active item will drop it onto a pedestal on the ground. Taking damage may result in dropping a passive item.
effects: [['Using an active item will drop it onto a pedestal on the ground.'], ["When Isaac takes damage, there is a 2% chance one of Isaac's passive items will drop on the ground."]]

name: Filigree Feather
description: [[Angel]]s drop [[Angel Room (Item Pool)|Angel Room items]] instead of key pieces when defeated.
effects: [['[[Angel]]s drop items from the [[Angel Room (Item Pool)|Angel Room item pool]] instead of key pieces when defeated.']]
notes: [['Items are dropped even if both key pieces are already acquired.'], ['If one key piece was acquired before picking up Filigree Feather, the next angel will drop the other key piece even with Filigree Feather equipped.'], ['{{Dlc|nr}} If both Angels are fought at the same time, only one item will be acquired.', ["{{Dlc|r}} Both Angels will drop items if they're fought at the same time."]], ['Angels rarely found in [[closet]]s in the {{s|Cathedral}} do not drop items, but ones found in {{R|Super Secret Room}}s do.'], ['Angels spawned from {{R|Sacrifice Room}}s will also drop items.'], ['The Fallen Angels that spawn during the {{e|Mega Satan}} fight do not drop items.'], ['The Angels that spawn during the {{R|Boss Rush}} do not drop items.']]

name: Door Stop
description: The last door Isaac went through stays open, allowing him to leave the room even if enemies are in it.
effects: [['While held, the last door Isaac went through stays open, allowing him to leave the room even if enemies are in it.', ['Does not prevent doors from closing due to other triggers, e.g. a {{R|Challenge Room}} door will still close upon opening a chest.']]]

name: Broken Padlock
description: Locks can be opened with explosions.
effects: [['Doors that require a {{E|key}}, {{E|Penny}} or a {{E|red heart|display=Heart}} can be opened with explosions.'], ["Does ''not'' work on {{R|Challenge Room}} doors (neither Normal Challenge Room, nor Boss Challenge Room)", ["Does ''not'' work on the golden door that leads to {{E|Mega Satan}} or the flesh door to {{E|Mom's Heart}} in {{s|Mausoleum}}/{{s|Gehenna}}.", 'The door to the {{s|Mausoleum}}/{{s|Gehenna}} can be entered with one bomb without the need to spend any hearts.', '[[A Strange Door|The Strange Door]] can also be opened without the need to sacrifice {{i|the Polaroid}} / {{i|The Negative}}.']], ['{{E|Chest}}s can also be opened with an explosion.', ["This includes all types of chests, including {{E|Mimic Chest}}s and {{E|Spiked Chest}}s with the only exceptions being {{E|Haunted Chest}}s and {{E|Mom's Chest}}."]], ['[[Key Block]]s can be destroyed with an explosion.']]
notes: [['Doors that require two keys ({{R|Vault}} and {{R|Dice Room}}) only require one bomb to open.'], ['The trinket allows bombing through locked doors, such as {{R|Treasure Room}}s and {{R|Arcade}}s before the room has been cleared which is normally not possible.', ['However, if the door has already been unlocked, this will not work.']], ['{{E|Mega Chest}}s require multiple explosions in order to be opened, just as when using keys.']]

name: Myosotis
description: When entering a new floor, up to four uncollected [[pickups]] from the previous floor spawn in the starting room.
effects: [['Spawns pickups left on the previous floor in the starting room of the current floor.', ['A maximum of 4 pickups can be spawned.']]]
notes: [['The "previous floor" status of trinkets can be reset by picking them up and dropping them again, allowing multiple other trinkets to be carried between floors.'], ['Trinkets that were left in the Treasure or Boss Room still transform into a {{P|Cracked Key}} during the [[Ascent]], potentially allowing you to gain large amounts of Cracked Keys.'], ['Spawns pickups on the first floor if {{I|R Key}} was used.'], ['Does not bring pickups from error rooms.']]

name: 'M

name: Teardrop Charm
description: [[Luck]]-based [[Status Effects|tear effects]] have a higher chance of occurring.

In this case, the chance goes to 100%.']], ['Has no effect on {{E|Rotten Heart}}s, {{E|Blended Heart}}s and any other type of heart.']]

Adds a <math>\\min(1/5+0.03"], ["\\mathit{Luck},1/3)</math> chance to spawn a {{E|Lil' Battery}} when clearing a room, independent of the room's original drop.", ["This means that, at 5 or more luck, your chance of spawning the Lil' battery will cap out 1/3."]]]

name: Brain Worm

effects: [['Tears snap 90 degrees to target enemies that they may have missed.']]
notes: [['The effect will not work if Isaac is too close to enemies.']]

description: +10 [[Luck]]. If Isaac takes damage, the trinket is destroyed and its effect is removed.

notes: [["{{M|Blood Donation Machine}}s, {{M|Devil Beggar}}s, {{M|Hell Game}}s, {{M|Confessional}}s, {{R|Curse Room}}s, {{R|Sacrifice Room}}s, {{E|Spiked Chest}}s, [[Bad Trip]] pills, {{E|White Fire Place}}s and the door to {{s|Mausoleum}}/{{s|Gehenna}} count as self-damage and won't destroy Perfection."], ['Every XL floor cleared counts as a single floor for the purposes of obtaining this trinket.'], ['Perfection can intentionally be dropped if Isaac must take damage for whatever reason, allowing him to keep it.'], ['Due to the unique method of obtaining it, Perfection can never naturally spawn as a {{A|Golden Trinket}}.'], ['10 Luck is coincidentally the highest amount of luck Isaac can have that would help with [[Room Clear Awards|room clear rewards]] paying out.'], ["If Isaac holds multiple copies of Perfection via {{i|Mom's Purse}} or {{i|Belly Button}}, upon taking a hit only one of them will get destroyed."], ["If Isaac gulps Perfection as he's taking damage (e.g. because of {{i|Marbles}}), the trinket will stay in your inventory as a passive item until the next instance of taking damage."]]

notes: [['Doors that were unlocked with the trinket have a blue hue emitting from them instead of the normal floor-dependent hue.'], ['The doors leading to the entrance of {{S|Downpour}} or {{S|Dross}} can be unlocked for free by Blue Key, though the blue room generated will be a dead end. Leaving the way Isaac came in will leave the door unlocked, allowing the player to continue normally.'], ['Rooms that require money to enter ({{R|Arcade}}s or rooms affected by {{i|Pay to Play}}) can also be opened for free.'], ['Doors that require two keys to open, such as {{R|Vault}}s or {{R|Dice Room}}s, will be opened instantly instead of waiting for the animation of both keys to be used.'], ['The door leading to {{E|Hush}} will also produce a blue room, despite not requiring a key.']]

name: Flat File
description: Causes all spikes to retract, making them harmless. Also affects the doors to {{R|Curse Room}}s.
effects: [['Makes all spikes retract, preventing them from dealing damage.', ['Most spikes leave behind holes or a visual cue showing where they would normally be.', 'The spikes around {{R|Curse Room}} doors are removed, allowing them to be entered and exited without taking damage.', 'Retracts damaging spikes from [[Spiked Rock]]s and {{E|Spiked Chest}}s/{{E|Mimic Chest}}s.', 'Removes the spikes from {{E|Poky|display=Pokies}}, {{E|Slide}}s, and {{E|Wall Hugger}}s.', ["Pokies, Slides, and Wall Huggers don't immediately stop moving once they are despiked, and are still able to push Isaac without dealing damage.", 'Has no effect on {{E|Grudge}}s, neither retracting their spikes nor despawning them.'], 'Causes {{E|Spikeball}}s to despawn.', ["Doesn't despawn or retract the spikes on {{E|Ball and Chain}}s.", "Doesn't cause the moveable spike balls in {{E|Singe}}'s boss room to despawn or despike."]]]]
notes: [['If Flat File is dropped in a room with spikes, the spikes will not extend again unless the room is left and re-entered.', ['Spiked Rocks will not re-extend their spikes.']], ["{{E|Mimic Chest}}s won't change their contents when Isaac is up close to them (visible with {{i|Guppy's Eye}}) if opened under the effect of Flat File."], ['Flat File also retracts the spikes in the center of {{R|Sacrifice Room}}s, making them unusable while the trinket is held. The spikes reappear after dropping the trinket and re-entering the room.'], ['Flat File does not prevent {{E|The Pile}} or {{E|Mama Gurdy}} from using their spike attacks.'], ['Also removes spikes from doors in the [[Cursed!]] challenge, making it much easier.']]

name: Telescope Lens
description: Increases the chance for {{R|Planetarium}}s to spawn even if one has been visited and allows Planetariums to spawn in [[Chapter 4]].

name: Mom's Lock
description: Grants the effects of a random [[Item Tags mom#Passive Collectibles|Mom item]] each room.
effects: [['Has a chance to grant the effects of a random passive [[Item Tags mom#Passive Collectibles|Mom item]] each room.']]
notes: [["The trinket can't give the effect of {{i|Mom's Coin Purse}} or {{i|Mom's Purse}}."], ['The trinket can give the effect of a Mom item Isaac already has.'], ["Mom's Lock doesn't count towards {{transf|Yes Mother?}}, no matter the effect."], ["Items with the lower [[item quality]] are more favored when Mom's Lock chooses an item."], ["The items chosen by the trinket won't grant [[health]] or spawn [[pickup]]s/consumables."]]

description: When Isaac enters a new room, has a chance to give him a Dice item as a consumable for the current room.

notes: [['If Isaac leaves and re-enters a room, Dice Bag will not try to give another dice when Isaac re-enters it.'], ['The dice given are determined by the amount of rooms cleared, and are not actually tied to specific rooms.'], ["Any dice can be given to Isaac, including ones that haven't been unlocked yet."], ['Dice Bag cannot give {{i|Spindown Dice}}, {{i|D Infinity}}, {{t|Cracked Dice}}, or {{p|Dice Shard}}.'], ['Dropping the trinket on the ground does not remove the dice until Isaac leaves the room.']]

notes: [['Cannot appear in [[Greed Mode]].'], ['The spawned Treasure Room will have one of 23 unique layouts for the floor.'], ['{{i|Card Reading}} will spawn a second portal if Isaac has the trinket upon entering Cathedral.']]

effects: [['Grants one [[Hearts#Red Heart Containers|heart container]] while held.', ['This heart container will be filled the first time the trinket is picked up.']]]
notes: [["If the only heart container Isaac has is the one given by Mother's Kiss, the trinket will be destroyed if the heart container is traded/consumed.", ['The trinket will get destroyed even if smelted via {{i|Smelter}}, {{i|Marbles}}, or a [[Pills|Gulp! pill]].']], ['If Isaac drops the trinket while he only has one heart container for health, he will have no health and die instantly.', ['This also means that using {{p|0 - The Fool?}} card will do the same, even if he has soul hearts.']], ['The extra red heart container can exceed the maximum coin heart container limit of {{c|Keeper}} and {{c|Tainted Keeper}}, allowing them to obtain more than 3 or 2 [[Health#Coin Hearts|coin hearts]], respectively.'], ['The heart added is a soul heart for {{c|???}} and {{c|Tainted Bethany}}, and a black heart for {{c|Dark Judas}} and {{c|Tainted Judas}}.', ['Using The Fool? card as one of these characters while holding this item will kill you instantly, as it drops the trinket, removing the last half soul heart that you normally would remain with.']], ['{{c|The Forgotten}} will always get a {{E|Bone Heart}} regardless of whether the body or the soul picked up the trinket.']]

description: Replaces all new chests, except {{E|Mega Chest|n}}s and {{E|Old Chest|n}}s, with {{E|Locked Chest}}s. Grants one {{e|key}} on pickup.
effects: [['Replaces all new chests with {{e|Locked Chest|display=Golden Chests}}.'], ['Modifies the contents of Golden Chests to be able to give [[card]]s and [[trinket]]s from a single chest alongside normal pickups.', ['Also allows Golden Chests to drop [[pill]]s.']], ['Gives Isaac one {{e|Key}} when picked up for the first time.']]
notes: [['{{e|Old Chest}}s and {{e|Mega Chest}}s cannot be overwritten by Golden Chests.'], ["The contents of Golden Chests can be changed retroactively by picking up/dropping Gilded Key. This can even be observed if Isaac has {{i|Guppy's Eye}}, allowing him to see what the chest would have if he did(n't) have the key and choose which payout he wants.", ["This also applies to chests that use Golden Chests' loot systems, such as {{e|Bomb Chest}}s and {{e|Eternal Chest}}s.", "Mega Chests will also have their contents modified if they didn't contain items.", 'The difference in contents between the two chest payouts are independent from each other; regardless of if the original chest had an item, card, trinket, or pickups, the modified chest can have any combination of them.', ['Modified chests are still unable to spawn pickups alongside items.']]], ['Gilded Key does not retroactively change chests that have already spawned into Golden Chests, or change their contents.'], ['Golden Chests in {{s|Chest}} will still spawn items.'], ['The unique {{e|Red Chest}}s in the beginning room of the {{s|Dark Room}} will be replaced.']]

name: Lucky Sack
description: Spawns a {{E|Grab Bag|n}} upon traveling to the next floor.
effects: [['Spawns a {{E|Grab Bag}} upon traveling to the next floor.']]

name: Wicked Crown
quote: Walk the path of the wicked
description: A {{R|Treasure Room}} and {{R|Shop}} appears in {{s|Sheol}}.
effects: [['Causes a {{R|Treasure Room}} and {{R|Shop}} to generate in {{Stage|Sheol}}.']]
notes: [['Cannot appear in [[Greed Mode]].'], ['The spawned Treasure Room will have one of 22 unique layouts for the floor.'], ['{{i|Card Reading}} will spawn a second portal if Isaac has the trinket upon entering Sheol.']]

name: Azazel's Stump
description: When clearing a room, adds a chance to turn into {{c|Azazel}} until clearing another.
effects: [['Gives Isaac a chance to visually turn into {{C|Azazel}} when clearing a room. Isaac keeps his hearts and items, but changes his tears to be a short range {{I|Brimstone}}, grants a x1.5 damage multiplier and gains the ability to [[Flight|fly]].', ['The effect lasts until clearing and leaving another room.', 'The effect can be taken to the next floor.', 'When playing as Azazel, the effect instead increases the width of his Brimstone akin to his {{I|Birthright}} effect.']]]
notes: [['Dropping the trinket after this transformation will not reverse it until a new room is cleared.'], ["The trinket only changes Isaac's appearance to be as Azazel's but doesn't change the actual character. This means that the trinket cannot be used to unlock [[achievements]] for Azazel."], ["The effect will not change Isaac's health mechanics. For example, {{C|The Lost}} will retain his zero health and {{I|Holy Mantle}}."]]

name: Dingle Berry
description: Spawns a [[Familiar#Dips|Dip Familiar]] upon clearing a room.
effects: [['Spawns a random friendly Dip upon clearing a room.'], ['Turns enemy Dips into friendly Dips, similar to {{I|Dirty Mind}}.']]

name: Ring Cap
description: Placing a {{E|bomb}} spawns an extra bomb for free.
effects: [['Places one extra {{E|Bomb}} for each bomb placed free of charge.']]
notes: [['The extra bomb is spawned in a random location next to the original bomb placed.'], ['The additional bomb is affected by any items that affect bombs.'], ['Ring Cap will also work with {{E|Giga Bomb}}s collected via {{T|Safety Scissors}}.'], ['Can be used to open the door to the {{s|Mines}} / {{s|Ashpit}} with only one bomb.'], ['This trinket has no effect on the [[Pills|Explosive Diarrhea]] pill.']]

name: Modeling Clay
description: Grants the effect of a random passive [[Item]] each room.
effects: [['Has a 50% chance to mimic the effect of a random [[passive item]] from the current room’s [[Item_Pool|item pool]] when entering a room.']]

name: Polished Bone
description: After clearing a room, adds a chance to spawn a [[friendly]] {{E|Bony}}.
effects: [['After clearing a room, adds a chance to spawn a [[friendly]] {{E|Bony}}.', ['The chance scales with [[Luck]], maxing at around ~50% at 51 luck.']]]

name: Hollow Heart
description: Grants an empty {{E|bone heart|n}} upon entering a new floor.
effects: [['Grants one {{E|bone heart}} container upon entering a new floor.', ['If Isaac has 12 heart containers, the added bone heart will replace the rightmost {{E|Soul Heart}} (if any).']]]

name: Kid's Drawing
description: While held, counts towards {{Transformation|Guppy}}.
effects: [['While held, acts as one of the three items needed for {{Transformation|Guppy}}.', ["The effect is lost if Kid's Drawing is dropped.", 'This includes instantly losing the transformation if it were obtained and three Guppy items are no longer present after the trinket is dropped.']]]
notes: [['If multiple copies of the trinket are obtained, they will each count as a Guppy item.'], ['The {{A|Golden Trinket}} will count as holding 2 Guppy items. {{Citation needed}}']]

name: Keeper's Bargain
description: Adds a chance for [[Devil Room|Devil Deals]] to cost [[Coins|money]] instead of [[health]].
effects: [['Adds a chance for [[Devil Room|Devil Deals]], {{R|Black Market}}s, and {{I|A Pound of Flesh}} {{R|Shop}} items to cost [[Coins|money]] instead of [[health]].', ['Items that would normally cost 1 [[Health#Red Heart Containers|heart container]] will cost 15 coins, while items that would normally cost 2 heart containers will cost 30 coins.']]]

name: Cursed Penny
description: Picking up [[coins]] teleports Isaac to a random room.
effects: [['Teleports Isaac to a random room upon picking up a [[coin]].']]
notes: [['The effect can teleport Isaac to any room aside from an undiscovered {{r|Ultra Secret Room}}.']]

name: Your Soul
description: Can be used to pay for a [[Devil Room|Devil deal]] without losing [[Health#Red Heart Containers|hearts]], and is then consumed.
effects: [['Grants 1 free [[Devil Room|Devil Deal]] item in exchange for the trinket.', ["After a Devil Deal has been taken, the trinket is removed from Isaac's inventory.", 'Also works in {{R|Black Market}}s and all other places where [[Health#Red Heart Containers|heart containers]] can be exchanged for an item.']]]
notes: [["Your Soul has no effect on Devil Deals that cost money instead of health, such as from {{t|Keeper's Bargain}}, or playing {{c|Keeper}} and {{c|Tainted Keeper}}."], ['Using Your Soul as {{c|The Lost}} / {{c|Tainted Lost}} grants the possibility of taking two items from the Devil Deal instead of only one.'], ['Using Your Soul still counts as taking a Devil Deal for the purpose of determining {{R|Angel Room}} eligibility.'], ['Taking multiple deals at the same time with {{C|Jacob and Esau}} will make both free. The trinket will still be removed.']]

name: Number Magnet
description: Increases the chance of earning a {{r|Devil Room}} by 10%, prevents {{E|Krampus}} from spawning, and generates special Devil Room layouts.
effects: [['Increases {{r|Devil Room}} chance by 10%.'], ['Prevents {{E|Krampus}} from appearing in the Devil Deal.'], ["If held before visiting the Devil Deal, the room's layout will be replaced with one of 11 special Devil Room layouts (6 in [[Greed Mode]]). These rooms contain 0-3 Devil Room items (most commonly 2-3), 1-3 {{E|Black Heart}}s, and several enemies from {{s|Sheol}}."]]

name: Strange Key
description: Unlocks the passageway to {{s|???}} and the {{e|Hush|n}} fight, regardless of the run duration. Using {{i|Pandora's Box}} grants it a special effect, consuming the key.
effects: [['Unlocks the passageway to {{s|???}}, regardless of run duration.'], ["If {{i|Pandora's Box}} is used while holding Strange Key, the following effects will occur instead of Pandora's Box regular effects:", ["The normal effect of Pandora's Box for that level is ignored, and instead 6 generally higher quality [[item]]s from a set of item pools are spawned.", "Both Pandora's Box and the trinket are consumed."]]]
notes: [['The items are chosen from the following [[item pool]]s: Treasure Room, Shop, Boss, Devil, Angel, Secret Room, Library, Golden Chest, Curse Room and Planetarium.', ['The Treasure Room item pool has a much higher chance to be chosen while the others have an equal chance.']], ['Both effects work even if the key has been turned into a passive item from items such as {{i|Smelter}} or {{i|Marbles}}.', ["Using Pandora's Box with the key in this state will remove the key from Isaac's Inventory."]], ['If playing with modal characters such as {{c|Tainted Lazarus}}, the character with the Strange Key must enter the room while holding it to cause the passage to open. Leaving and re-entering the room after switching to the correct character will open the door normally.'], ["Unlike with {{i|Mama Mega!}}, {{e|Mom's Heart}} / {{e|It Lives}} must be beaten for the passageway to {{s|???}} to open."]]

name: Lil Clot
description: Spawns a clot [[familiar]] that mimics Isaac's movements and tears. It dies for the current room after taking too much damage.
effects: [['Spawns a {{i|Sumptorium}} blood clot [[Familiar]] on the ground next to Isaac. This familiar moves and shoots through the same inputs as Isaac, effectively acting as a second source of tears.'], ["The familiar uses Isaac's [[tears]], [[range]], [[shot speed]], and [[tear effects]], and deals 0.35x Isaac's [[damage]]."], ['Lil Clot will die after it gets hit 3 times, and will respawn when entering a new room.']]
notes: [['Holding the "drop" button lets Isaac move independently from Lil Clot.'], ['Lil Clot will persist after the trinket is dropped, but it will not respawn unless the trinket is picked up again.'], ['Lil Clot spawns in a random location near Isaac when the trinket is first picked up.'], ['Duplicating Lil Clot trinkets will cause them to stack, allowing Isaac to control multiple Lil Clots at once.']]

name: Temporary Tattoo
description: Drops a {{E|chest}} after clearing a {{r|Challenge Room}}, or an extra [[Boss_(Item_Pool)|Boss item]] after clearing a {{r|Boss Challenge Room}}.
effects: [['Drops a {{E|chest}} after clearing a {{r|Challenge Room}}, or an extra [[Boss_(Item_Pool)|Boss item]] after clearing a {{r|Boss Challenge Room}}.']]

name: Swallowed M80
description: Isaac explodes upon taking damage.
effects: [['Isaac has a 50% chance to explode when he takes damage, similarly to if he used {{i|Kamikaze!}}.', ["The explosion deals 185 damage and uses most of Isaac's bomb synergies.", "The explosion does '''not''' cause additional damage to Isaac."]]]
notes: [['Causes {{Machine|Devil Beggar}} and {{Machine|Hell Game}} to become essentially unplayable, as any damage that could trigger Swallowed M80 will likely cause Isaac to explode, killing them.'], ['Causes {{Machine|Blood Donation Machine}}s and {{Machine|Confessional}}s to act as if they were destroyed from the explosion despite surviving and functioning normally, resulting in extra coin and {{E|Red heart|display=Heart}} drops.'], ['The explosion cannot be triggered by {{R|Curse Room}} or {{R|Sacrifice Room}} spikes.']]

name: RC Remote
description: Instead of trailing behind Isaac, [[familiar]]s are directly controlled by the same inputs as Isaac's.
effects: [["Instead of trailing behind Isaac, [[familiar]]s are directly controlled by the same inputs as Isaac's."], ['Holding the drop button will allow Isaac to move while keeping the familiars in place, identical to {{c|Jacob and Esau}}.']]

name: Found Soul
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that copies Isaac's movements and scales with [[damage]] and [[tears]]. If it takes damage, it will die and respawn on the next floor.
effects: [["Summons a [[Familiar]] that follows Isaac's exact movements, akin to {{C|Jacob and Esau}}, and shoots spectral tears.", ["The ghost uses Isaac's [[speed]], [[tears]], [[range]], [[shot speed]], [[tear effects]], and [[trinkets]], and deals 0.5x Isaac's [[damage]].", 'The familiar has collision and can be separated. Holding down the "drop" button keeps the familiar in place.', 'When Isaac places a {{E|bomb}}, the familiar will drop one as well at no cost.', 'The familiar can press {{E|Silver Button|display=Buttons}}.']], ['The familiar dies after taking any damage, and will respawn on the next floor.']]
notes: [['If Found Soul is dropped before its death animation finishes, it will still be available for the current floor if picked up again.'], ['If Found Soul touches a {{m|Devil Beggar}}, {{m|Blood Donation Machine}}, or {{m|Confessional}}s, it will use the machine or beggar once for free and then die.']]

name: Expansion Pack
description: Once per room, using an active item triggers another random active item effect.
effects: [['Upon use of an [[activated item]], activates the effect of another random activated item.', ['The random effect is any activated item with charge time of 1 or 2 rooms ( with the exception of {{I|MEtronome}} and {{I|D infinity}}). View the page on activated items for a complete list.', 'Timed recharge and infinite use items trigger the effect once per room. Re-entering the room will allow Expansion Pack to trigger again.']]]

name: Beth's Essence
description: Upon entering an {{R|Angel Room}}, spawns 5 wisp orbitals. Giving money to {{M|Beggar}}s can spawn wisps.

name: The Twins
description: Adds a chance to duplicate one of Isaac's [[familiar]]s when entering a new room.
effects: [["Adds a 50% chance to duplicate one of Isaac's [[familiar]]s when entering a new room."], ['If Isaac has no familiars, spawns {{i|Brother Bobby}} or {{i|Sister Maggy}} instead.']]
notes: [['The following items/trinkets cannot be duplicated:', ["{{t|???'s Soul}}", "{{i|Abyss}} / {{t|Apollyon's Best Friend}}’s unique attack locusts", '{{i|Dead Bird}}', '{{i|Dead Cat}}', '{{i|The Intruder}}', "{{t|Isaac's Head}}", "{{i|Isaac's Heart}}", '{{i|Giant Cell}}', '{{i|Halo of Flies}} / [[Familiar#Pretty_Fly|Pretty Flies]]', '{{i|Milk!}}', "{{i|Monster Manual}}'s temporary familiars", '{{i|Quints}}', '{{i|Spin to Win}}', '{{i|Stitches}}', '{{i|The Swarm}}', '{{t|Umbilical Cord}}', '{{i|Vanishing Twin}}', "Wisps given by {{t|Beth's Essence}}, {{t|Beth's Faith}}, {{i|Book of Virtues}}, {{i|Jar of Wisps}}, {{i|Lemegeton}}, or {{i|Vengeful Spirit}}"]]]

name: Adoption Papers
description: {{R|Shop}}s can sell [[familiar]]s, which will always be at a discounted price.
effects: [['{{R|Shop}}s and {{R|Black Market}}s now sell [[familiar]]s instead of the usual item selection.', ['The familiars are chosen from the [[Baby Shop (Item Pool)|Baby Shop item pool]].', 'While holding the Adoption Papers, the familiars are discounted to 10 coins. If the papers are dropped, they cost 15 coins.']]]
notes: [['A shop that has already been entered will not have its item selection changed, nor will dropping the papers revert them to normal.'], ['In [[Greed Mode]], only the shop pool item is replaced with a familiar and discounted.', ['This also applies to all shop pool items when playing as {{C|Tainted Keeper}}. Familiars spawned from the Treasure Room pool remain unaffected.']], ['Familiars that appear in both the Shop pool and Baby Shop pool ({{I|Buddy in a Box}}, {{I|King Baby}}, etc) will be discounted by Adoption Papers even if the shop was visited before the trinket was held.']]

name: Cricket Leg
description: Adds a chance to spawn a random [[locust]] when killing an enemy.
effects: [['Has a chance to spawn a random [[locust]] when killing an enemy.']]

name: Apollyon's Best Friend
description: Spawns an attack locust [[familiar]] which will fly forward while Isaac shoots.
effects: [["Spawns an attack locust [[familiar]] identical to the default ones spawned by {{i|Abyss}}. It will fly forward while Isaac is shooting and deals contact damage equal to Isaac's [[damage]]."]]

name: Broken Glasses
description: Gives a 33% chance to add a '?' item to {{R|Treasure Room}}s. Only one item can be taken. The extra items on the alt path are revealed instead.
effects: [['50% chance of adding an extra blind item in {{r|Treasure Room}}.', ['When one of the items is taken, the other disappears.', 'The extra blind items in {{s|Downpour}}, {{s|Mines}} and {{s|Mausoleum}} and their alternate stages have a 50% chance to be revealed instead.']]]
notes: [['The effect includes instances where pedestal items would be replaced with something else, such as the [[Pica Run]] challenge. If there is not a blind equivalent, both items will simply be shown.'], ['Works in both Treasure Rooms in {{mode|greed}} Greed Mode.']]

name: Ice Cube
description: Adds a chance to [[petrify]] enemies when entering the room. Killing the petrified enemy [[freeze]]s it.
effects: [['Upon entering a room, each enemy has a 20% chance to be [[Status_Effects|petrified]]. Enemies that have been petrified by Ice Cube are [[Status_Effects#Frozen|frozen]] when killed, including those killed up to 2 seconds after the petrification effect ends.', ['Petrification lasts for 4 seconds after entering the room.', 'The chance for enemies to be petrified increases with [[luck]], reaching 100% at 40 Luck.', 'Enemies spawned during [[Greed Mode]] waves will not be petrified.']]]
notes: [['The freezing effect is the same granted by {{i|Uranus}} tears.'], ['Bosses cannot get frozen, but have the same chance to be petrified when entering a room.'], ['Every room has a predetermined set of enemies that are going to be petrified. Re-entering the room will not change this, similarly to [[Champion]] enemies.']]

name: Sigil of Baphomet
description: Grants an invulnerability shield for 1 second after killing an enemy.
effects: [['[[Temporary_Buffs#Shield|Shield]]s Isaac for 1 second after killing an enemy.', ["If another enemy is killed while Isaac is shielded, another second is added to the shield's duration.", 'Up to 5 seconds of invincibility can be accumulated.']]]
notes: [['If Isaac is in range of an enemy that explodes on death, the shield will not come up before Isaac takes damage from the explosion. Other on death effects, like firing shots, are still guarded against.'], ['In {{r|Arcade}}s, {{machine|Blood Donation Machine}}s or {{machine|Devil Beggar}}s can be used without losing health by killing the red flies from {{machine|Shell Game}}s and gaining a shield.'], ['Additionally, losing in a {{machine|Hell Game|d}} always spawns a red spider, the shield generated from killing it guarantees a payout for each half-heart.'], ['During the fight against {{E|Ultra Greed}}, destroying {{E|Ultra Greed Coin (Spinner)|display=Ultra Greed Coins}} will not grant a shield, despite being considered as enemies.']]
